com.linecorp.armeria.common.stream

Class DefaultStreamMessage<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.linecorp.armeria.common.stream.DefaultStreamMessage<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of element signaled
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    StreamMessage<T>, StreamWriter<T>, org.reactivestreams.Publisher<T>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DefaultHttpRequest, DefaultHttpResponse

    public class DefaultStreamMessage<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements StreamMessage<T>, StreamWriter<T>
    A StreamMessage which buffers the elements to be signaled into a Queue.

    This class implements the StreamWriter interface as well. A written element will be buffered into the Queue until a Subscriber consumes it. Use StreamWriter.onDemand(Runnable) to control the rate of production so that the Queue does not grow up infinitely. 

    
 void stream(QueueBasedPublished<Integer> pub, int start, int end) {
     // Write 100 integers at most.
     int actualEnd = (int) Math.min(end, start + 100L);
     int i;
     for (i = start; i < actualEnd; i++) {
         pub.write(i);
     }

     if (i == end) {
         // Wrote the last element.
         return;
     }

     pub.onDemand(() -> stream(pub, i, end));
 }

 final QueueBasedPublisher<Integer> myPub = new QueueBasedPublisher<>();
 stream(myPub, 0, Integer.MAX_VALUE);
